newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Group Five aims to treble earnings by 2000.
newsitem.headline: Group Five aims to treble earnings by 2000.

text.p: South African construction to engineering firm Group Five Ltd said on Friday that it aims to treble its earnings by the end of the century.
"We hope to treble the size of the company by 2000 in terms of earnings," said Group Five financial director Howard Turner.
Group Five was positively placed for the future said newly appointed chief executive Mike Lomas.
"We've set our growth objectives for the year 2000 and we're going to stick to that," he said.
On Thursday the firm's shares rose on the back of the news of the appointment of Lomas, at one stage touching a day's high of 730 cents.
Group Five said it had appointed Lomas with immediate effect following the resignation of Thuenis Kotzee on May 13, amid policy differences with the board.
At 1220 GMt the firm's shares were at 720 cents, up 20 cents from Thursday's close.
